newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares up, electronics stocks steal show.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares up, electronics stocks steal show.

text.p: Singapore shares closed higher on Monday after a day when electronics stocks stole the limelight but failed to inspire market-wide lift, dealers said.
"The broader market hasn't really moved much even though some individual shares have been doing well," one dealer said.
The day's run-away performer was multi-media firm Creative Technology, leaping Singapore $2.70 to S$21.00 after massively improved interim profits.
But the huge surge did not influence the key Straits Times Industrials Index edging up 1.59 to 2,218.06 at the close.
Broader sentiment saw shares trading sideways for the rest of the week as the Chinese New Year and Muslim Eid Al-Fitr festivals approached. Creative led the day's 142 gainers.
The market's 215 losers were headed by OCBC Bank's foreign shares, down S$0.80 to S$18.40 on Friday's news that merger talks with Malaysia's Pacific Bank had collapsed.

Dealers saw interest in Malaysian over-the-counter stocks with motor trader Oriential Holdings Bhd up S$0.90 at S$12.10 while eight million warrants traded in developer Renong Bhd moved the price up S$0.015 to S$0.940.
